title: Mid Wales Mountain Bike Trail
tagline: Empty trails and epic descents at Dyfi
suitableFor: Experienced mountain bikers with good fitness levels who are comfortable with technical trails and varied weather conditions.
notSuitableFor: Beginner mountain bikers, those with limited fitness, or those who prefer perfectly groomed trails.

stops.title: Dyfi Bike Park
stops.description: Start the adventure at Dyfi Bike Park, known for its challenging downhill trails built by Dan Atherton. Expect steep gradients and technical features.

wetAlt.title: Centre for Alternative Technology
wetAlt.description: Explore sustainable living and technology in a covered environment.

budgetAlt.title: Explore Machynlleth Trails
budgetAlt.description: Ride the free trails around Machynlleth forest, offering a mix of terrain and skill levels.

stops.title: Riverside Cafe Machynlleth
stops.description: A popular cafe in Machynlleth serving hearty lunches and good coffee. Expect friendly service.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Llyn Clywedog
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own lunch at the scenic Llyn Clywedog reservoir.

stops.title: Hafren Forest Trails
stops.description: Explore the extensive network of trails in Hafren Forest, offering a mix of singletrack and forest roads. Be prepared for some climbing.

wetAlt.title: Visit King Arthur's Labyrinth
wetAlt.description: An underground storytelling adventure in Corris.

budgetAlt.title: Walking trails around Llyn Clywedog
budgetAlt.description: Explore the walking paths around the lake.

stops.title: Hafren Forest Hideaway
stops.description: A remote hostel perfect for mountain bikers looking for a quiet night's sleep. Basic but clean and comfortable.

budgetAlt.title: Wild Camping (responsible)
budgetAlt.description: Find a suitable spot in Hafren Forest to pitch a tent. Ensure you leave no trace. (Permits may be required; check local regulations)

stops.title: Coed y Brenin Mountain Biking
stops.description: Explore the famous trails of Coed y Brenin, offering a variety of routes from easy to black-graded. Rent bikes at the visitor centre if needed.

wetAlt.title: Visitor Centre Exploration
wetAlt.description: Browse the visitor centre, grab a coffee and read about local wildlife.

budgetAlt.title: Explore the lesser-known trails
budgetAlt.description: The parking is still free, so pick out a trail and go anyway

stops.title: Cafe at Coed y Brenin Visitor Centre
stops.description: Enjoy a casual lunch at the cafe located within the Coed y Brenin visitor centre. Good for a quick bite before heading on.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Coed y Brenin
budgetAlt.description: Bring your own food and enjoy it at the picnic area.

stops.title: Llandegla Mountain Biking
stops.description: Experience the thrills of Llandegla, with trails for all skill levels.

wetAlt.title: The Lodge (Llandegla)
wetAlt.description: Enjoy the warmth of an indoor fireplace, board games, read a book, or swap stories in the local pub.

stops.title: The Lodge (Llandegla)
stops.description: A bunkhouse perfect for mountain bikers looking for a quiet night's sleep. Basic but clean and comfortable.

budgetAlt.title: Wild Camping (responsible)
budgetAlt.description: Find a suitable spot in Llandegla Forest to pitch a tent. Ensure you leave no trace. (Permits may be required; check local regulations)

stops.title: Morning mountain biking in Llandegla Forest
stops.description: A final morning of mountain biking in Llandegla Forest on trails that fit your experience levels.

wetAlt.title: Indoor cycling session
wetAlt.description: Rent a session at an indoor cycling gym in Wrexham

budgetAlt.title: Walking trails around Llandegla
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy free walking trails instead of the costlier mountain biking

stops.title: Oneplanet Adventure Cafe
stops.description: Enjoy a final lunch at Llandegla Forest before departing.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a final lunch at Llandegla Forest before departing. Bring your own.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: Mid Wales weather can be unpredictable. Pack for all conditions, including rain, wind, and sunshine. Check the forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends and during school holidays, especially on the A470. Allow extra time for travel. Parking at popular trail centres can fill up quickly, so arrive early or consider carpooling.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Booking is essential for Dyfi Bike Park, especially on weekends. Check opening times and trail conditions before you travel. Bike hire should also be booked in advance.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This itinerary requires a good level of fitness. The trails are challenging, and you'll be spending several hours in the saddle each day. Be prepared for climbs and technical descents.
